items.title: Titelstrijd in Engeland tussen Arsenal en City? 'We zullen zien'
items.summary: Arsenal en Manchester City lijken vooralsnog uit te vechten wie dit seizoen de Premier League wint. Manager Pep Guardiola krijgt vragen over de titelstrijd in aanloop naar het duel met Sunderland. Hij haalt zijn schouders op als hij de vraag krijgt of het tussen die twee ploegen zal gaan. 'We zullen zien.'

items.title: Napoli say Rasmus H√∏jlund‚Äôs permanent move from Manchester United a ‚Äòformality‚Äô
items.summary: Striker has scored nine goals since joining on loan Champions League qualification brings obligation to buy The Napoli sporting director, Giovanni Manna, considers Rasmus H√∏jlund‚Äôs permanent transfer from Manchester United a ‚Äúformality‚Äù. H√∏jlund joined the Serie A champions on loan last summer and the Denmark striker has scored nine goals in 20 appearances, including a double in Sunday‚Äôs 2-0 win at Cremonese. Napoli are third in Serie A, occupying one of Italy‚Äôs four Champions League places. Continue reading...

items.title: Hier wordt gevoetbald op oudjaars- en nieuwjaarsdag
items.summary: De bal rolt, altijd. Zo ook op oudjaars- en nieuwjaarsdag. Voetbalfans kunnen zodoende rond de jaarwisseling genieten van bijvoorbeeld de Premier League en de Afrika Cup. Een overzicht van de wedstrijden.

items.title: Slot baalt van bibber-slotfases bij Liverpool: 'Missen wisselmogelijkheden'
items.summary: E√©n van de problemen voor Liverpool dit seizoen is dat de ploeg heel ver terugzakt in niveau als ze een goal tegen krijgen. Dat vindt ook manager Arne Slot. Voordat Slot zich bij zijn dierbaren kon voegen om feestelijk het nieuwe jaar in te luiden, stond er nog √©√©n verplichting in de agenda: Hij schoof aan voor de persconferentie in aanloop naar het competitieduel met Leeds United, dat ons op nieuwjaarsdag zal verblijden.

items.title: Slot verdedigt zomeraankopen: 'Je leven staat een beetje op zijn kop'
items.summary: Arne Slot verwelkomde deze zomer voor meer dan 500 miljoen euro aan nieuwe aankopen. De manager van Liverpool kende een moeizaam eerste halfjaar en vraagt om geduld. 'De grootste aanpassing die je moet maken als je vanuit het buitenland komt, is dat je ervaart hoe intens de Premier League is.'

items.title: Waarom Huiberts Mijnans niet naar PSV liet vertrekken, ADO haalt spits terug
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Modric: Mourinho at Madrid 'made Ronaldo cry'
items.summary: Croatia and AC Milan midfielder Luka Modric said on Wednesday that Jose Mourinho was such a tough manager during their time at Real Madrid that he once reduced star player Cristiano Ronaldo to tears.

items.title: 'Are you sure?' - Guardiola questions two-horse race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has questioned whether the Premier League title race this season is a two-horse race between his Manchester City side and leaders Arsenal.

items.title: Slot sees positives as Frimpong and Kerkez adapt to end of a full-back era
items.summary: Liverpool head coach‚Äôs new full-backs have struggled Slot expects improvement as squad and signings settle Arne Slot has said Liverpool remain ‚Äúa work in progress‚Äù in both full-back positions but backed Jeremie Frimpong and Milos Kerkez to make their mark as his team stabilise. Slot admits Liverpool are still adjusting to the end of the Trent Alexander-Arnold and Andy Robertson era with injuries and disruption limiting the impact of their designated successors, including Conor Bradley. Frimpong has improved since returning from his second hamstring injury of the season, however, and provided assists for Hugo Ekitik√© and Ryan Gravenberch in the recent victories over Tottenham and Wolves. Slot believes the summer signings Frimpong and Kerkez, from Bayer Leverkusen and Bournemouth respectively, will prove valuable assets for Liverpool, with their pace essential for the modern game. Continue reading...

items.title: Masters Snooker 2026: Draw and schedule as Murphy aims to defend title
items.summary: The 2026 edition of snooker's Masters runs from January 11-18 at London's Alexandra Palace with Shaun Murphy the defending champion and Ronnie O'Sullivan a star attraction.

items.summary: West Ham's interest in Norway forward Jorgen Strand Larsen has cooled after discovering Wolves want ¬£40m for the 25-year-old.

items.title: Martin √òdegaard relocates his missing rhythm to dictate Arsenal‚Äôs tempo again
items.summary: Rejuvenated by his goal on Saturday and free from injuries that have disrupted his season, Arsenal‚Äôs captain led their destruction of Villa When Arsenal really needed Martin √òdegaard, the captain finally rediscovered his magic touch. Gabriel Magalh√£es had just opened the scoring against Aston Villa after a first half in which Mikel Arteta‚Äôs nervous side were struggling without the influential Declan Rice. Then it happened. Jadon Sancho was waiting to receive a pass from Youri Tielemens inside Villa‚Äôs half but, before the forward knew it, √òdegaard had pinched the ball and was haring towards Emiliano Mart√≠nez‚Äôs goal. A jink back on to his left foot fooled Tielemens and allowed √òdegaard to play through the perfect through ball for Mart√≠n Zubimendi to score the crucial second. It was the fifth goal or assist that Zubimendi has contributed to since he joined in the summer ‚Äì the joint-best return of his club career ‚Äì and the Spaniard‚Äôs impact was rightly hailed by a delighted Arteta. ‚ÄúCredit to his teammates as well, how easy they make it for him,‚Äù said the Arsenal manager in a nod to √òdegaard. Continue reading...

items.title: Joshua spends second night in hospital after fatal car crash in Nigeria
items.summary: Anthony Joshua remains in a Nigerian hospital recovering from the car crash that killed two of the British boxer's close friends.

items.title: January transfer window 2026: what every Premier League club needs
items.summary: Aston Villa have a decision to make about Harvey Elliott, Brentford have money to spend and Burnley and Everton need goalscorers A busy summer with the arrival of more than ¬£250m in reinforcements has proved to be invaluable given the number of injuries that have hit Arsenal, particularly in defence. But that also makes any more expensive incomings unlikely in January, especially after the timely return of the influential Gabriel Magalh√£es this week. A loan signing or two could be on the cards, however, with Arsenal not having filled either slot so far after bringing in Neto from Bournemouth and Raheem Sterling from Chelsea last season. Mikel Arteta could do with more cover at right-back and must also decide whether to allow Ethan Nwaneri to go on loan with the 18-year-old having made only three starts in all competitions. Ed Aarons Continue reading...

items.title: From breakups to contract minefields: it‚Äôs make or break time for academy players
items.summary: Young footballers have big decisions to make at this time of year as academy directors aim to sign the most talented Any 15- or 16-year-olds who should be revising for their mock GCSEs are probably finding that the end of December is a testing time of year. For those in academy football, it can often be make or break. While the very best ‚Äì such as Arsenal‚Äôs record-breaking Max Dowman, who made headlines in October when he agreed terms on a scholarship deal ‚Äì secured their futures in good time, many discovered their fates just before the 31 December deadline. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always the sort of classic breakup. It‚Äôs not you, it‚Äôs us,‚Äù says Dr Chris Platts, who has studied the academy system for more than a decade and offers support to young players and their families. ‚ÄúBeing released before Christmas isn‚Äôt nice for a kid. Then they‚Äôve got about five months before their GCSEs and those five months are now going to include a lot of trials and uncertainty going into the following year.‚Äù Continue reading...
